Title: Prawn and Avocado Omelette
Description: Your average omelette gets a spring update in this fresh recipe.
Instructions: Crack the eggs into a mixing bowl, add a tablespoon of milk and a pinch of salt and pepper, and whisk until well beaten.
Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat and add a tablespoon of butter or oil. Swirl the pan to coat the bottom evenly.
Once the butter has melted or oil is hot, pour in the beaten eggs, and let them cook for a minute or until the edges start to set.
Add the sliced avocado, cooked prawns, and grated cheddar cheese to one side of the omelette.
Use a spatula to fold the other side of the omelette over the filling.
Cook for another minute or until the cheese has melted, and the filling is heated through.
Use a spatula to carefully slide the omelette onto a plate.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy your delicious prawn and avocado omelette!

Title: Katsu Curry
Description: Katsu Curry (Japanese Curry with Tonkatsu Nuggets and Fried Egg)
Ingredients: 1 (2-inch) cinnamon stick, broken into small pieces
1 tablespoon brown or black mustard seeds
1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, plus more to taste

Title: Beef Taco
Description: Elevate a pack of beef mince into vibrant tacos. Go to the extra effort of making your own spice mix for even more flavour, and use soft tortillas

Title: Classic Koream Bibimbap
Description: Rice mixed with vegetables, meat, an egg, and chili pepper paste

Title: Healthy Salad Sandwich
Description: This salad sandwich with herb mayo is the perfect quick and easy lunch recipe. Use any fresh vegetables you have to make a delicious, filling meal.

Title: Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls
Description: Traditional Vietnamese fresh spring rolls (goi cuon) consist of pork, shrimp, lettuce and herbs wrapped in soft chewy rice paper. They are beautiful to look at and great as a refreshing appetizer or even a light meal. Your guests will be impressed!

Title: Homemade Hotpot
Description: Hot pot is a tasty, festive and communal cooking and dining experience that involves little more than a table set with a portable butane stove, a pot of bubbling broth and platters of raw meat and/or seafood and vegetables.

Title: Vegan Acai Bowl
Description:
The best Acai Bowl is a thick and creamy smoothie made with acai berry and served in a bowl with a variety of delicious toppings. It’s packed with nutrition and easy to make!-1 Acai: Find frozen acai puree in the freezer section of your local grocery store
- 2 Milk: Use your favorite plant based milk or whatever you have on hand. I typically use oat milk, almond milk, macadamia nut milk, or coconut milk
- 3 Fruit: To ensure a thick and creamy smoothie bowl, use frozen fruit for blending. Common fruit mixes include blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries. Include a banana to naturally sweeten the acai bowl.
- 4 Toppings: I like my acai bowls to have a crunch and be topped with a variety of fresh fruit, nuts, and seeds. My secret ingredients is a little spoonful of almond butter!

Title: Toasted Bread
Instructions: Place bread in toaster for desired amount of time and remove.

Title: Curried Rice
Description:
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 3 garlic cloves finely chopped
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 teaspoons curry powder
- 2 cups long-grain white rice
- 3 1/4 cups water
- 2 teaspoons salt

1. Cook onion and garlic in oil in a 3- to 4-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat, stirring, until softened. Add curry powder and rice and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add water and salt and boil, uncovered, without stirring, until surface of rice is covered with steam holes and grains on top appear dry, about 8 minutes.

2. Reduce heat to as low as possible, then cover pan with a tight-fitting lid and cook 15 minutes more.

3. Remove pan from heat and let rice stand, covered, 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.

Title: Roasted Tomatoes
Description:
- Fresh Tomatoes – washed and quartered
- Olive Oil
- Onion – roughly chopped
- Garlic Cloves
- Salt and Pepper

1. Begin by preheating the oven to 450 degrees. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper and place quartered tomatoes onto it. Drizzle olive oil over the tomatoes, then sprinkle on salt and pepper, amount will depend on personal preference.

2. Roast the tomatoes in the oven for approximately 20 minutes, or until they start to brown on top, keep an eye on them so they don’t burn. Remove tomatoes from oven and let cool.

3. Once the tomatoes are fully cooled, transfer them to a Ziploc freezer bag. Label and date the freezer bag and store for up to 6 months.

Title: Hard Boiled Eggs
Description:
Ingredients:
- 1 to 6 large eggs
- 1 tray of ice cubes

1. Place large pot of water on stove at high heat, enough water to cover eggs completely. Carefully lower eggs into pot and continue to boil for 30 seconds. Cover tightly, reduce heat to low (water should maintain a bare simmer), and continue cooking for 11 minutes. Serve immediately if serving hot. If serving cold, immediately place eggs in bowl of ice water and allow to cool for at least 15 minutes before peeling under cool running water.

2. To peel, first gently tap hard-boiled eggs all over to thoroughly crack the shell, then remove shell under a thin stream of running water. (The water helps get under the shell and lift it off the egg.)

Title: Garlic Lemon Green Beans
Description:
- 1 pound green beans fresh, ends trimmed1 tablespoon olive oil
- 3 garlic cloves finely minced
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 2 teaspoons lemon zest

1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil on high heat. Once boiling, add the green beans and cook, boiling, for 3 minutes.
2. Drain the beans and lay them on a paper towel and gently pat dry.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet on medium heat. Once hot, add the green beans and garlic. Cooking, stirring often, until the beans just begin to blister. Add the lemon juice and 1 teaspoon of the zest. Cook until the beans are tender but still a bit crunchy.
4. Sprinkle with remaining zest and serve.
